title: section 4 and section 262 of the Planning and Development Act 2000 (No. 30 of
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Planning and Development Act
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Planning and Development Act 

2000 (Exempted Development) (No. 2) Regulations 2020. 

(2) These Regulations shall be included in the collective citation the 

Planning and Development Regulations 2001 to 2020.
text_norm: 1 (1) regulation may cited planning development act 2000 (exempted development) (no 2) regulation 2020 (2) regulation shall included collective citation planning development regulation 2001 2020

title: section 4 and section 262 of the Planning and Development Act 2000 (No. 30 of
heading: In these Regulations “relevant period” means the period commencing on
text_raw:
2. 

In these Regulations “relevant period” means the period commencing on 
the making of these Regulations and ending on the day on which Part 3 of the 
Health (Preservation and Protection and other Emergency Measures in the Public 
Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of 2020) ceases to have effect by virtue of subsection 
(3) of section 2 of that Act.
text_norm: 2 regulation relevant period mean period commencing making regulation ending day part 3 health (preservation protection emergency measure public interest) act 2020 (no 1 2020) cease effect virtue subsection (3) section 2 act

title: section 4 and section 262 of the Planning and Development Act 2000 (No. 30 of
heading: 3. Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Planning and Development Regulations 2001
text_raw:
3. Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Planning and Development Regulations 2001 
shall have effect during the relevant period as if, in column (1) under the heading 
Class 14, the following paragraph were inserted after paragraph (a): 

“(aa) from use for the sale of food for consumption on the premises to 
use for the sale of food for consumption off the premises.”.
text_norm: 3 part 1 schedule 2 planning development regulation 2001 shall effect relevant period column (1) heading class 14 following paragraph inserted paragraph (a) (aa) use sale food consumption premise use sale food consumption premise

title: section 4 and section 262 of the Planning and Development Act 2000 (No. 30 of
heading: 4. Where a premises is used during the relevant period for the sale of food
text_raw:
4. Where a premises is used during the relevant period for the sale of food 
for consumption off the premises in accordance with Article 3, then, upon the 
expiration of the relevant period - 

(a) 

the premises may be used for the sale of food for consumption on 
the premises in accordance with the permission that applied in 
respect of that premises immediately before the commencement 
of the relevant period, and 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 31st March, 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 (b) 

the use of the premises for the sale of food for consumption off 
the premises shall not be exempted development. 

[92] 3 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

27 March, 2020. 

EOGHAN MURPHY, 

Minister for Housing, Planning and Local Government. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [92]

title: section 4 and section 262 of the Planning and Development Act 2000 (No. 30 of
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations are made under sections 4(2) and 262(4) of the Planning and 
Development Act 2000, as amended. 

The Regulations amend the existing Planning and Development Regulations 
2001 (the Principal Regulations), to provide exemptions for restaurants to 
operate a service to enable the temporary sale of food for consumption off 
premises (i.e. takeaway/ delivery) that previously did not provide this service, 
during a period specified in the Regulations.. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [92] 5
